body: I don't think this will change her as a support, but will buff her mid laning power.

*****Raises the hand***** Question: how can Nami work mid lane? 
One of my biggest issues with her is waveclear (no pun intended), and how she simply doesn't work on her own from my experience.

Lulu at least got her Glitterlance...whereas Nami only has her ultimate, her "wave clear", by comparison.
Nami can stand on her own on mid lane and win most match ups - the problem is weak waveclear since you max Q last

And that's the thing: you max Q first, you can waveclear, but leaves you with zero damage against the enemy midlaner - you max W or E first, you can trade and perhaps win the matchup 1v1, but that leaves you with zero waveclear against the winions which WILL push down your tower quite fast.

I've tried Echo, Nashor, I've tried AS Nami with Nashor and Wit's End, and even tried AD Nami with Hurricane just for lolz, but the result was always either of the above: managing the minions or the enemy champion, but never both.
I personally max q first just to improve waveclear.  But even with q max she is inferior to most midlaners in waveclear, since they have bigger aoe abilities or 2 basics that hit minion in aoe.

You want to max W to win lane - you can get a nashor's tooth for the attack speed and on hit to help push out waves; but Nami needs either a direct buff as in a tool to waveclear (like maybe W splooshes in an area to deal magic in an area, reduced cooldown but no bounces so no heal, when uses against non-champions) or a new item that specifically is to help low wave clear AP champions to clear waves; i think the item would  be better since it will open up more champions to get played that you rarely see or never see

Why would we give champs with low wave clear more options to clear waves quickly? Those champions have other strengths. If we remove their weakness in wave clear, then where is their weakness now? What can we do against an ezreal that one shots a wave?
I did not say one shot - it would be an item similar to Hurricane or Hydras that help clear waves, not be super ultimate 5 Ziggs waveclear status

But, I mean.. Often times the best way to counter these champions is to push them under tower. What the heck are we going to do if we can't do that? (Eg if fizz can clear the wave out just as well as ahri, RIP ahri forever and ever)

Fizz has super good wave clear; also if it is an item that works like hurricane then it would be range attackers, if like hydra then melee attackers - dont forget you actually have to buy the item, items arent just magically given to you, and the item would focus on more an aoe and utility of wave clear and be weak against champion effectiveness unlike the other items--- so assassins and ezreal who want raw damage would give up a lot for it, and you can still shove them in early game

I have played Nami mid a few times. Her wave clear is great. The Q (bubble),well placed, can almost clear the wave.. . Turn on E and finish off the wave. Her CC is awesome, sustain+damage on W, extra poke/AA damage on E.. Speed boost on every ability lol.. it really is fun. Catches ppl off guard too bc you never see it.
Point and Click Poke that also functions as a heal to make trades more favourable, a nice AA amp to last hit easier, The Bubble;nuff said and Tidal Wave with the AP of a mid laner can turn fights.

TBH as someone who fucking loves AP supports, I really wish they would buff up a bit of the support's ap scalings, I know AP janna used to be insanely op I guess, but I'd really love to play her midlane more, I've done it a few times with relative success. I also wish that Leona had higher ap ratios, then you could play her as an AP assassin like Diana... heh
However when someone like AP Nami can be played to great success in the hands of someone that knows how to do it, I'm not necessarily sure that it needs to be buffed hugely just as an off build. It would help to make the midlane even MORE diverse, which I'm not sure would be a bad thing, but I'm sure theres more people against changes like this than for it. Sadly.
Honestly I'd rather they buff the items than the ratios. Would Ardent Censer really be break the game if it cost 200 more and gave 60 AP? Same with Frost Queen's Claim.

A friend of mine had an interesting idea for Frost Queen's:

Lower its AP a notch (to 40 or so), but give it a Rabadon's-esque passive that increases all your AP by a percentage. Making it a core item for supports building AP support items, to somewhat alleviate the issue of the small-ish AP amount on most support items. Make the %-value inferior to Rabadon's and the passive a named unique, to prevent solo lane abuse of it.

AP Janna was never insanely OP. Morello just wanted her gutted because she went mid with her Q as waveclear. (note, that Q is also the slowest moving skill shot in the game, and she had no other damage besides W to hit champs with, which they also gutted!)

Instead of making Q do reduced damage to minions, they gutted every AP scaling in her kit over and over, because fuck you AP Janna mains :'). Ironically, now we have Viktor who does the same thing as AP Janna did.

Viktor's laser provided a fairly lengthy knock-up over a very long range, and Viktor himself provided an enormous shield to others with AD attached, global movespeed, a moderate damage + slow point and click spell, and a large knock-back + heal for his entire team? AP Janna mid, like AP Soraka mid, was safe to an extreme while still holding their own since their kit was meant to protect themselves plus one other - so if they didn't have the other to worry about, they had extreme amounts of safety with which to hold their own.

AP Janna had her reason for being picked and it wasn't summarized solely by "waveclear." Viktor doesn't do what AP Janna did besides waveclear, so it really isn't ironic at all.

Do note that I never mentioned balance in my comment.

She's already a surprisingly strong AP mid because of how Ebb and Flow's bounce mechanic works, where after a certain AP threshold (something like 200-300AP) the bounces heal and damage for *more* after the initial hit rather than less.

Her wave clear sucks though, and if you want this buff to help with that, you should instead ask for something like a bigger AoE, but only the center area (same size as live) would actually suspend enemies, sort or like Aatrox's Q sweetspot or Soraka's Starcall sweetspot. Boom, she now has actual wave clear, but her support function is virtually unchanged outside some fringe cases where she might trade a little better.
Perhaps have it so when the bubble pops it lets out a small aoe around it that damages enemies (Not those that are in the center though).

Nami actually has by far the best AP scaling in the game already. Since the percent change in effect of Ebb and Flow scales with AP, this means that the damage (or heal) on its third and final hit will actually scale with the cube of her AP. With 1000 AP, Ebb and Flow will deal ~1870 damage. If she somehow magically got 2000 AP, her W would deal a whopping 6793 damage!

Unfortunately, due to fairly low constant factors, at more realistic quantities of AP, her damage is pretty unexceptional.

The point isn't that she doesn't scale with ap, the point is she has terrible waveclear.  Her q is her only waveclear ability besides the long cooldown ult.  A better ap ratio would allow her to kill the caster minions with one q earlier.
Oh, I know. My comment wasn't saying that mid Nami is fine already, it's just sharing a cool fact.
